column13:
This table summarizes Fall 2014 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, grouped by school. It shows how many undergraduate and graduate credit hours each school generated, with totals, adjustments for graduate “extra credits,” and their conversion into FTE values.

Explanation of Columns:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – the number of credits taught at each level.

Total Credit Hours – combined undergrad and graduate credit hours.

Graduate Extra Credit – additional credits attributed to graduate-level courses.

Grand Total Credit Hours – the overall credit hour load after adding graduate extra credits.

FTE (Full-Time Equivalent) – enrollment values standardized (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12), showing how many full-time students the credit hours represent.
